sen.j: 藤原是公（ふじわら の これきみ、神亀4年（727年）- 延暦8年9月19日 (旧暦)（789年10月12日））は、奈良時代後期の公家。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Korekimi (727 – 12 October 789) was a court noble in the late Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Korekimi (727 – October 12, 789) was a court noble in the late Nara period.

sen.j: 祖父は藤原南家藤原武智麻呂、父は藤原乙麻呂。
sen.e: He had the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan, FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, as his grandfather and FUJIWARA no Otomaro as his father.
His grandfather was FUJIWARA no Muchimaro of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan and his father was FUJIWARA no Otomaro.
sen.cmt: 英訳文章を簡潔化しました。

sen.j: 初め黒麻呂と称し、765年（天平神護元年）是公と名を改めた。
sen.e: He first named himself as Kuromaro and later changed it to Korekimi in 765.

sen.j: 761年（天平宝字5年）従五位下に叙され、以後左衛士督・式部大輔を歴任し、774年（宝亀5年）参議となった。
sen.e: In 761, ever since he was promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), he worked as Saejinokami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and Shikibu no taifu (Chief Judge) a number of times and became the Councilor in 774.

In 761, he was granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was consecutively Saejinokami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and Shikibu no taifu (Chief Judge) and then became Sanji (councilor) in 774.
sen.cmt: ・「ever since」を削除しました。・「he was promoted」 → 『he was granted』に変更しました。（「叙され」の意味合いが出るようにしました。）・「a number of times」を削除して、『consecutively』を追加することで「歴任」の意味を表現しました。
sen.e: In 761, he was granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was consecutively Saejinokami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and Shikibu no taifu (Chief Judge) and then became Sanji (councilor) in 774.

sen.j: その後も中納言・大納言と累進して、783年（延暦2年）には右大臣に任じられた。
sen.e: Even after that, he moved up his rank to Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) and Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) and was assigned to become Udaijin (Minister of the Right) in 783.
Later, he was promoted to Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) and Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) and was assigned to become Udaijin (Minister of the Right) in 783.
sen.cmt: ・「Even after that」 → 『Later』に変更しました。・「he moved up his rank to」 → 『he was promoted to』に変更しました。
sen.e: Later, he was promoted to Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) and Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) and was assigned to become Udaijin (Minister of the Right) in 783.

sen.j: 789年（延暦8年）従二位右大臣兼中衛大将で没し、従一位が追贈された。
sen.e: In 789, he died with the title of Junii Udaijin (Junior Second Rank Minister of the Right) and Chueitaisho, and received a higher rank, Juichii (Junior First Rank) after his death.

sen.j: 時務に熟練した有能な官人であったという。
sen.e: He was a competent government official and had a lot of knowledge about the entrance exams for the officials.
sen.cmt: 時務の訳として当世の急務と官吏採用試験の二つがありましたので、後者のほうを選択しました。
sen.e: He was a competent government official and well informed on current affairs.
sen.cmt: 時務はcurrent affairsとしました。
